message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to discuss the sale of our premium product with you. I believe it's a fantastic opportunity for you to acquire a high-quality item that will meet your needs. I'm willing to offer it to you for $7,000. This is a great deal, and I'm confident you won't find a better price anywhere else.

I appreciate your enthusiasm for the product, Alice. However, $7,000 is a bit higher than I was hoping to pay. I'm willing to consider a price of $6,500. I believe this is a fair price considering the market value of the product.

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand your concerns about the price, but I'm willing to compromise. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer the product to you for $6,800. This is a fair price considering the value the product brings to your business. I believe it's a great opportunity for you to acquire a high-quality item at a competitive price.

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, Alice. However, $6,800 is still a bit higher than I'm comfortable with. I'm willing to go a bit lower and offer $6,200. I believe this is a more reasonable price for the product, and I'm willing to make a decision if you can meet me at this price.

I understand your concerns, Bob, and I'm willing to make another compromise. However, I'm not willing to go as low as $6,200. I'm willing to offer the product to you for $6,500, which is still a great deal considering the value it brings to your business. I'm confident you won't find a better price elsewhere.

Alice, I appreciate your persistence, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to meet you at $6,300, but that's as low as I'm willing to go. I'm starting to think that buying from John might be a better option for me.

I understand that you're getting close to making a decision, Bob. I'm willing to make one more compromise. I'm willing to meet you at $6,350, which is still a great deal considering the value the product brings to your business. I'm confident that this is the best price you'll find anywhere, and I'm willing to make a final offer to seal the deal.

Alice, I appreciate your persistence, but I'm starting to get a bit frustrated. I'm willing to meet you at $6,250, but that's as low as I'm willing to go. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider buying from John.

I understand your frustration, Bob, and I apologize if my previous offers haven't met your expectations. However, I'm willing to make one more compromise. I'm willing to meet you at $6,275, which is still a great deal considering the value the product brings to your business. I'm willing to make this final offer to seal the deal and avoid any further negotiations.
Alice, I've made it clear that $6,250 is my maximum price. I'm not willing to go any higher. I'm starting to think that buying from John is the best option for me.
